item.title: Pokemon Fan Creates New Forms for Haxorus and Three More Pokemon
item.description:
Highlights

  • New fan-created Pokemon forms are inspired by the Tapu guardians from Pokemon Sun and Moon, incorporating their unique designs creatively.
  • Alola introduced regional forms and Z-moves, adding depth to gameplay and expanding the Pokemon universe with new features and concepts.
  • The Tapu guardians in Pokemon Sun and Moon, each representing an island in Alola, inspired the fan's new forms for Haxorus and other Pokemon.

A talented Pokemon fan has created new forms for Haroxus and three other Pokemon based on the Tapu guardians. In nine generations, Pokemon introduced players to different Pokemon and regions. Alola stands out in the Pokemon universe for having references beyond Asia, such as being Hawaii-based and offering new features that became famous among fans.

Setting for Pokemon Sun and Moon , Alola introduced Pokemon regional forms , a concept that has been present in Pokemon games ever since. Another Gen 7 feature was the addition of Z-moves, a different mechanic in which Pokemon can access a new power with the help of Z-Crystals. The Alola Pokedex also introduced Pokemon fans to 81 new Pokemon, including the Legendaries Solgaleo and Lunala, and the group known as the Ultra Beasts. Alola is a Pokemon region with many peculiarities. Using an iconic group of Gen 7 Pokemon as inspiration, a talented Pokemon fan gave new looks to four Pokemon.

Related
Pokemon Fan Creates Nearly Life-Size Chien-Pao Statue
A Pokemon fan creates a nearly life-size Chien-Pao statue, and showcases their incredible rendition of the Legendary Pokemon with the community.

Reddit user Kampy5567 created new forms for Haxorus and three other Pokemon inspired by the Tapu guardians. One of the best Gen 5 Pokemon , Haxorus has received a makeover worthy of its status, changing the design of its fangs and tail with colors inspired by Tapu Koko. The legs of the unusual Gaganacl, which is made of sedimentary rock and salt rock, are yellow, and the structures that form its body have Tapu Bulu's design. Exploud has a horn on its head and blades on its arms, and its colors represent those of Tapu Fini. Dusknoir's body is colored different shades of pink and has a sort of tentacle under its arms, both references to Tapu Lele.

Who Are the Pokemon That Defend the Islands of Alola?

Known as guardian deities, the Tapu are the Legendary Pokemon featured in Pokemon Sun and Moon . Each Tapu is responsible for one of Alola's islands, and their appearances are inspired by different things. The powerful Tapu Koko guards Melemele Island, and its appearance is vaguely reminiscent of a roster. Tapu Lele, the protector of Akala Island, resembles a butterfly, and the guardian of Ula'ula Island, Tapu Bulu, reminds a bull. With a design vaguely resembling a swordfish, Tapu Fini watches over Poni Island.

The designs created by the OP are striking because they naturally incorporate the designs of the Tapu guardians, and for having lore that contextualizes the fan art. According to the artist, their artwork is based on the idea of the Tapu choosing their wardens, and blessing them with new forms to defend Alola. Pokemon fans can also check out the publication for other details such as stats, the quartet's moveset, and the fact that they can use the power of Pokemon 's Z-Moves .

item.title: Tekken 8 Reveals Patch Notes for Next Update
item.description:
Highlights

  • Tekken 8 update focuses on balance adjustments aligning with the roadmap and addressing player frustrations.
  • Controversial post-release monetization in Tekken 8 leads to mixed player reactions and review bombing.
  • Update 1.0.4 includes new items in Tekken Shop, bug fixes, and character balance adjustments for better gameplay.

Following the recently announced Tekken 8 roadmap, Bandai Namco has revealed the details of what will be in the next Tekken 8 update. This fits right in with the recent Tekken 8 roadmap , as it said Spring updates would be focused on balance adjustments, which is most of what is seen here.

Tekken 8 launched to acclaim but has been beset by controversies like the Tekken Shop being added post-release, as well as the Fight Pass, cosmetics, and other monetization. This has brought Tekken 8 to an odd point where there are players review bombing it on one hand, and others pushing for the fun meme stage of the Waffle House. One way to bring everyone together, before the new character and season 2 drop, is to help improve the balance and bugs that have frustrated players in some ways.

Related
Tekken 8 Developers Explain Why They Included an In-Game Shop
Tekken 8's developers address the decision to include an in-game shop and microtransactions after its controversial announcement.

With the Tekken 8 update notes posted today, it seems Bandai Namco is trying to do that for Tekken 8 , at least in part, when this patch launches on May 8th. The patch notes are chunky, and full of a lot of minute changes, but before that is reached, a mention of new items coming to the Tekken Shop is shared: new Ninja Pack and Shinobi Pack outfits available for all characters. Additionally, a legacy costume for Lili and a free avatar customization option for everyone are available. Then a handful of bug fixes are mentioned that should help with rollback processing, and Tekken 8 's online play , which has been a recent issue.

Following that is six pages worth of balance adjustments, and it promises a lot of tweaks and changes. In this update, they plan to address characters who are not able to showcase their strengths or unique abilities, while in June's planned 1.05 update they will be balancing characters with overly strong moves or combos. Mentioned specifically to be nerfed in 1.05 are Victor, Lili, King, Paul, and Yoshimitsu. June's patch is also planned to "enhance the value of player defensive techniques" so that situations where one player has total control of attacking are avoided.

Characters who have moves adjusted in the 1.0.4 update specifically (and not just as part of the general move tweaks) include: Asuka, Azuncena, Bryan, Claudio, Devil Jin, Dragunov, Eddy Gordo , Feng, Hwoarang, Jack-8, Jin, Jun, Kazuya, King, Kuma/Panda, Lars, Law, Leo, Leroy, Lili, Paul, Raven, Reina, Steve, Shaheen, Xiaoyu, Yoshimitsu, and Zafina.

Players will find that replays before the Tekken 8 update will be deleted from the online data. Thus, if players want to view them in the future, video recordings outside of the game should be made, as they will also be unavailable even if they are downloaded. Character behavior and moves will also be updated in Super Ghost Battle and Ghost Match at the same time.

Tekken 8 Patch Notes for Update 1.0.4

The patch notes on the Tekken 8 website are here, except for the specific move changes. Those are all available on the Tekken website .

Version

  • Ver.1.04.00

Date and Time of Update

  • [PDT] May 7th (Tuesday) 19:00 approx
  • [UTC] May 8th (Wednesday) 2:00 approx
  • [JST] May 8th (Wednesday) 11:00 approx

Server Maintenance Schedule

  • [PDT] May 7th (Tuesday) 18:30 – 24:00
  • [UTC] May 8th (Wednesday) 1:30 – 07:00
  • [JST] May 8th (Wednesday) 10:30 – 16:00

During server maintenance, all online content will not be accessible.

Update Contents

  1. New items added to the TEKKEN SHOP
  2. Feature improvements and bug fixes
  3. Properties and/or behavior for select moves of select characters were adjusted.

Update Details

  • New items added to the TEKKEN SHOP
    • New costume packs “NINJA Pack” and “SHINOBI Pack” will be available for all playable characters.
    • A legacy costume for “Lili” will be available.
    • One free avatar customization item.

  • Functional improvements, Bug fixes.
    • Optimization of packet transmission and reception as well as rollback processing during online matches.
    • Improvement of the logic for detecting processing delay displayed as red icon in the bottom right corner of the screen during online matches.
    • The parameter names for each item in “PLAY STATS” have been improved for better clarity.
    • Improvement made to “My Replay & Tips” allowing players to skip entrance and victory animations during replay playback.
    • Optimized loading times in “Exciting Replay.”
    • Fixed an issue in “Character Customization” where it was possible to customize both “Kijin Face Guard” and “Surgical Mask” for Reina simultaneously.
    • Fixed a bug in “Character Customization” where the skin color of the upper body was not as intended.
    • Other miscellaneous improvements and bug fixes were implemented.

  • Behavior/properties of moves will be adjusted for some characters.

Scope of Update

The application of the update data will result in the following impact on each mode and feature.

  • “DOWNLOADED REPLAYS”, ”MY REPLAY & TIPS”: Replay data from before the update will be unavailable for playback.
  • “ONLINE REPLAY”: Replay data from before the update will be deleted.
  • “SUPER GHOST BATTLE”, ”GHOST MATCH”: Character behavior and move properties will reflect that of the post-update state.

item.title: New Pokemon Go Player Reaches Level 50 in Incredibly Short Amount of Time
item.description:
Highlights

  • Leveling up in Pokemon GO is a challenging journey, especially from level 40 to 50 due to exponential requirements.
  • An avid player reached level 50 in under nine months by catching over 72,000 Pokemon and using various in-game purchases.
  • Achieving level 50 in Pokemon GO unlocks exclusive rewards like Ultra Balls and Elite Charged TM, motivating players to push their limits.

An incredibly dedicated Pokemon GO player reached level 50 under nine months after creating their account in the game. By participating in Pokemon GO activities such as catching Pokemon and taking part in Raids or events, players earn XP to level up their accounts. But there is one extremely challenging milestone for Pokemon GO players, and that is getting to level 50.

The journey for Pokemon GO players to get from level 40 to 50 is very challenging because level-up requirements increase exponentially. To level up to level 41, for example, Pokemon GO players need to do things such as have a Legendary Pokemon and power it up 20 times, earn 6 million XP, and catch 200 Pokemon in a single day. The difficulty is bigger to make level 50 a reality, with Pokemon GO players needing 999 Excellent Throws, 30 million XP, and other things. But one Pokemon GO trainer was undeterred and showed that not only is it possible to achieve this feat, but in an incredibly short period.

Related
Pokemon GO Fans Accuse the Game of 'Misleading Marketing'
Some unhappy Pokemon GO fans accuse the popular mobile game of 'misleading marketing' when it tries to sell some specific items.

Reddit user matthewormatt has reached level 50 in Pokemon GO in less than nine months. The screenshot they shared shows the status of their account, which was created on August 2, 2023. With more than 72,000 Pokemon caught and over 13,000 PokeStops visited, the player explains that they began by playing for a few hours every day. As they became more familiar with the various Pokemon GO events , they began to focus on events with double XP as a reward.

Level 50 is the Pokemon GO "Endgame"

To help push their rush towards level 50, they said they bought Remote Raid Passes, Premium Battle Passes, and Lucky Eggs. Now that they've reached level 50 in Pokemon GO in less than a year, the player plans to "truly enjoy the events," rather than focusing on the XP reward. Pokemon GO players who reach level 50 like matthewormatt, get rewards such as Ultra Balls, Elite Charged TM, and an exclusive jacket to equip their avatar.

As well as becoming a more casual player, they said they will wait for the maximum level in Pokemon GO to increase. At the moment, level 50 is the maximum a player can go, although there are rumors about Niantic increasing the Pokemon GO level cap to 60. Until that happens, feats like this trainer's will continue to be impressive, as many Pokemon GO players take a long time to reach level 50, and some don't even come close after years of playing the game.

item.title: Stardew Valley Update Added Secret SpongeBob Reference
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pineapples can now be placed in fish tanks in Stardew Valley, seemingly as a nod to SpongeBob SquarePants.
  • Fishing in the game offers more than just profit, allowing players to catch items for cooking and decorating fish tanks.
  • This possible nod to SpongeBob SquarePants has sparked excitement among players, with some wanting more Easter eggs from media franchises.

A recent Stardew Valley update has added a potential homage to SpongeBob SquarePants , as the pineapple item can now be placed in fish tanks. While Update 1.6 added a boatload of new content to Stardew Valley , the game’s creator, Eric “ConcernedApe” Barone, included a few more surprises in subsequent updates in the weeks following, such as allowing players to place more items in their fish tanks.

While fishing is only one of many things players can do in Stardew Valley , the skill has many benefits. The activity allows players to catch fish and other items that can be used to sell for profit or be cooked into dishes, which can grant potential buffs beyond simply increasing energy and health. In addition, marine life caught from fishing can be used as decorations in fish tanks, providing a way of beautifying a space. Some players have even gone beyond adding a simple tank to their house, designing incredible rooms dedicated to marine life instead. Recently, a new update made decorating fish tanks even better.

Related
Stardew Valley Players Point Out One Missing Fruit That Would Be a Game-Changer
Stardew Valley players discuss one fruit that's Stardew Valley missing from the game and how it would enrich the experience in a variety of ways.

As highlighted by Reddit user Emma_JM on the game’s subreddit, Update 1.6.4 for Stardew Valley added the option to include the pineapple as a non-fish item in fish tanks. Unsurprisingly, many players believe this was a secret reference to the SpongeBob SquarePants cartoon, specifically the pineapple that the titular sponge calls home. When posting to Reddit, Emma_JM included a screenshot from presumably their in-game fish tank, showing what the tropical fruit looked like underwater. It is worth mentioning that the update added the option to include seven other non-fish items in fish tanks.

Stardew Valley's Pineapple Can Be Placed in Fish Tanks

Many players were excited by this potential Easter egg related to the SpongeBob SquarePants show. Many users applauded the addition, with the Reddit post already gaining over 3.4K upvotes. In the comments, several users wished that even more items related to the popular Nickelodeon cartoon could be incorporated into fish tanks to better replicate the street that SpongeBob lives on . For example, some hoped that ConcernedApe would add Dried Starfish to the list of placeable items in fish tanks as a tribute to Patrick Star.

As this recent post from Emma_JM highlights, ConcernedApe has added an impressive amount of content to Stardew Valley in Update 1.6 and its subsequent patches. While additions like new festivals and crops might make a more substantial difference in a playthrough of the game, players often enjoy looking for secrets in Stardew Valley . With so much stuff being added to the indie game recently, it seems only a matter of time before fans find other Easter eggs, possibly based on other popular media franchises.

item.title: Pokemon Home Feature Would Make it Way More Convenient
item.description:
Highlights

  • Pokemon Home could be integrated into the games' PC system for easier Pokemon transfers, improving convenience for players.
  • Nintendo Switch limitations make opening Pokemon Home alongside games difficult, hindering seamless gameplay transitions.
  • While potential issues exist with integration, improvements could streamline future titles and enhance player experience.

A Pokemon fan has shared an idea on how the Pokemon Home app and Pokemon games could come together, which would make the experience much more convenient. Pokemon Home 's functions are appreciated by players, but actually using the system could be streamlined.

Pokemon Home is an app on the Nintendo Switch and mobile devices that can be utilized to transfer Pokemon from one game to another. To use Pokemon Home with Pokemon Scarlet and Violet , it's necessary to install it as a separate app on the Switch. From there, players can start it up, look at the list of Pokemon available to transfer, and then execute it. However, one player has pointed out how changing this system to better integrate it into the games could improve the experience.

Related
New Pokemon Scarlet and Violet Event is Huge for Shiny Hunters
A new Pokemon Scarlet and Violet event is proving to be huge for shiny hunters that are looking to complete their collection.

Pokemon player NeoSeth shared their idea to integrate Pokemon Home into the Pokemon PCs that were present in the older games. Pokemon PCs have become largely unnecessary at this point, as NeoSeth points out, because many of their functions have been integrated into the game's basic menu. For example, players no longer need to use a Pokemon PC to access their Pokemon storage boxes and transfer Pokemon to and from them. Unfortunately, the same ease of use isn't the case with Pokemon Home .

The Problem with Pokemon Home on the Nintendo Switch

Due to how the Nintendo Switch works, it's not possible to simply open up Pokemon Home while leaving Scarlet or Violet running in the background, or vice versa. Only one program can run at a time on the Switch, so players have to completely shut down one program to start another. While it doesn't take an excessively long time to boot Pokemon Scarlet and Violet up again after the fact, it's an obstacle that could be avoided entirely in future games if the PC was brought back with Pokemon Home integrated into it.

NeoSeth did note that there could be some potential hiccups to integrating the two systems, like opening the door to potential Pokemon duplication exploits . However, the developer could likely put safeguards in place for problems like this and take action if an exploit were discovered. However, the removal of the PC hasn't stopped exploits from appearing, so bringing it back wouldn't necessarily make a big difference in that regard.

While this suggestion may not be implemented by Game Freak, it could be one step the company could take to help streamline future titles. Fans will be expecting a lot from Pokemon Legends: Z-A , and with many fans already having large rosters of Pokemon available to them from Scarlet and Violet and other Nintendo Switch Pokemon games, it could be the right time to make transferring them much more convenient.
